attributes.action: Debate the referendum results before the Article 50 vote
attributes.background: The margin was just over 1m of 33.5m voted/46.5m eligible; areas of high immigration voted remain; under 44 year olds voted remain (18-24: 73%, 25-34: 62; and 35-44 58%); Scotland and Northern Ireland voted remain.
attributes.additional_details: MPs need to uphold their duty to act in the interests of the nation as a whole  and claims of a 'decisive' vote are inaccurate

attributes.action: Incentivise employers to accept CVs over application forms
attributes.background: The government should be working to make getting a new job as fast and simple as possible, yet those seeking work have to fill out forms that outline the same information in slightly different formats over and over again. The government should incentivise streamlining the job application process.
attributes.additional_details:
It is deeply inefficient for employees to repeatedly redraft their contact details, educational qualifications, and job histories, during every single job application. 

It would radically increase labour market efficiency if companies accepted CVs containing general information, followed by more specific questions about the candidates aptitude for the advertised role.

Candidates could then apply for more jobs in less time, shrinking their level of requirement for tax funded welfare support.

attributes.action: Cease backing UN resolution outlawing Israel’s presence beyond 1967 borders
attributes.background: Britain's vote to outlaw Israel's presence beyond the 1967 borders is unacceptable and it is supporting a one-sided motion. We must stop putting pressure on Israel, and allow the Israelis and Palestinians to negotiate their positions. This is key to prevent negative effects of religion on Britain.

attributes.action: Cyclists should have legally registered identification plates on their cycles.
attributes.background: This is to enable identification of, and consequences for, cyclists who break road traffic laws and cause minor or major road incidents.
attributes.additional_details: There have been previous attempts to pass such laws but they have been generally tied in with the introduction of proposed insurance and road tax for cyclists.  Most cyclists, however, also own cars and so the concept of paying for road tax and insurance twice is an incredibly controversial one.  In order to keep this proposal straightforward, I am suggesting simply that cycle registration becomes compulsory in the same way car registration is, as a means of identification.

attributes.action: Open places for homeless and people alone to socialise
attributes.background: With Christmas day coming up many people will be spending it alone and walking into new year alone, this petition is to try and get the government to agree to try and fund places for people like this. As people of the community to volunteer to help give the homeless and others to not feel alone.
attributes.additional_details: This may not be an issue for the government to agree on but it could be possible for them to consider funding socialise centres! Yes we have many places for these people like "feed the homeless" but what about the people sat alone on Christmas Day with nobody, reminding themselves they are alone! By signing this it will show the government their funding would be useful and many people in the community would love the opportunity to volunteer. Thankyou for reading please sign! See what we can do.

attributes.action: Make the police non emergency number 101 a freephone number.
attributes.background: Currently the cost of calling 101 is 15p per call, yet the similar non emergency number of the NHS 111 is free, this needs to be resolved as most people in the UK use mobile phones and mostly on contracts where their minutes wouldn't cover the 15p charge to report a crime.

attributes.action: Back date money owed by HMRC to families with disabled children
attributes.background: HMRC has announced that it will only pay back money owed to families with disabled children for 2016/17. This is wrong. Families living day to day with the challenges of supporting a disabled child are themselves vulnerable. HMRC must repay all DLA tax credits owed to these families without delay.

attributes.action: Somaliland Recognition
attributes.background:
There is very few and far countries left in the world without full international recognition. Seat with united Nations and all that goes with been a recognise state.
Yet right in the middle of most strategic countries on this planet sets this forgotten  country of Somaliland.
attributes.additional_details:
for the last 25 years its people are calling for the international  community to give them basic freedom to self determine their own affairs and become state. Yet, the Republic of Somaliland has survived to become a relatively stable and democratic state.
Somaliland and UK always had strong ties, working on development, security and regional stability. This can be build Somaliland standing it’s own foot and recognised by statehood

attributes.action: Introduce daily meditation to the national curriculum
attributes.background: We wish to petition for meditation to be introduced into the national curriculum at nursery, primary and secondary levels. The benefits of daily meditation on a developing brain are endless. Focus, clarity, calm - fundamental qualities that can help a young mind stay healthy and happy into adulthood
attributes.additional_details:
"If every 8 year old in the world is taught meditation, we will eliminate violence from the world within one generation." - Dalai Lama

With ever rising rates of young suicides globally our young are becoming ever more detached and disenfranchised. Mental health is now a very serious issue for our growing generations. As little as 5 minutes of gentle meditation each morning will help our young to feel more connected to themselves and the world around them.

attributes.action: Employers to give mothers returning from maternity leave flexible working hours.
attributes.background: This is an issue that many mothers have wrongly encountered. We as mothers should be given the right to have flexible working hours that balance our home and work life. We should not be discriminated for having children.
attributes.additional_details: Applying for flexible working hours to be abolished. Mothers should be offered flexible hours in their current position or offered in same grade position elsewhere. If this is not feasible, lower grade flexible working position.

attributes.action: Introduce the drinking age of 21
attributes.background:
Alcohol has many side affects. It's scientifically proved that it can damage the devolving brain cells of the teenagers.
However the majority of 21 year old are fully developed, therefore the effects of alcohol upon the brain is significantly lower.

attributes.action: Make dealing with panic attacks part of standard first aid courses/training
attributes.background: If we are going to treat mental health the same as any other illness or condition, it needs to be normalised and people need to be trained on how to manage a situation if someone has a panic attack. They are becoming increasingly common, particularly in the workplace.
attributes.additional_details:
At least 1 in 10 people suffer from panic attacks (NHS) - meaning on average at least 1 person in every small business may be a sufferer. Many people will be afraid of the symptoms which can be similar to those of a heart attack - so people need to be made aware of the tell-tale signs and how to manage them.
Hours of work are lost from anxiety related issues, so let's make our nation more open to talk and comfortable when dealing with anxiety and panic attacks.

attributes.action: Legislate against premature marketing of festivals, especially Christmas
attributes.background: The excitement of Christmas is spoiled by premature marketing in shops, 'papers and TV. We are not killjoys, but tinselled TV ads and festive trees in Malls in early November dwindles our joy well before the event. We propose, under penalty, the first day of marketing for Christmas as 1st of Dec.
attributes.additional_details: Other festivals can be included in legislation (e.g. 1 week prior to Valentines, Easter, Halloween) but the law must first target Christmas. We accept there are commercial ventures that that may be exempt since they rely on festivals such as Christmas for much of their business and therefore need to market early, e.g. Christmas hamper savings, turkey butchers, greeting card shops, booking for a Christmas party, etc. Punishments for breaking the law should raise money for children's charities.

attributes.action: Increase tax allowance to £14,976 per year so minimum wage pay no tax on income
attributes.background: We believe this would encourage people back into full time employment whilst reducing benefits claims to a degree. This action may influence our economy as there would be potential for more disposable income.

attributes.action: Take action to address the humanitarian crisis in Syria
attributes.background: This petition has been created to ask for public support for a Parliamentary debate on how the UK can help to address the humanitarian crisis in Syria.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition follows on from a recent petition "Air-drop life-saving aid into the starving cities in Syria." "https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/173574

Although there was no debate on the above petition the response stated that "the Committee would, however, look favourably on future petitions calling for action to address the humanitarian crisis in Syria, if they have substantial public support."

attributes.action: Make all wheelie bins across the country a standardised colour.
attributes.background: The confusion caused by different coloured wheelie bins throughout different councils for general, garden and recycling waste leads to many people putting their waste in the wrong bin. Meaning less waste is recycled and more sent to landfill. There is no benefit to the current system.

attributes.action: Investigate the relationship between ISIS and the Syrian regime
attributes.background: In 2015 a little Syrian boy, Aylan, is washed up dead on the shores of Italy, and the shocked world said: “Enough. Enough. The conflict must end.” But today the war continues. Why?
attributes.additional_details:
In a war do people always say who they are, or what they are doing? ISIS claims to be a Sunni group, yet attacks all the other Sunni rebel groups, and very little the Shia-based regime. Raqqa has been the ISIS capital in Syria since 2014, yet regime bombing against it has been negligible.

An unexposed connection, both economic and military, between ISIS and the Syrian regime is one of the main blocks to peace.
 
Are we fully investigating one of the strangest wars the world has ever seen?

attributes.action: Medical professionals required to report to DVLA any person found unfit to drive
attributes.background: We believe that all medical professionals should be required to report any person found unfit to drive.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament should create a new law which requires any medical professional aware of a person's inability to drive safely to report them to DVLA so that their licence would be withdrawn.

attributes.action: Stop weighing young children at school and labelling them in weight catergories
attributes.background:
Children as young as 4 are being weighed at school and parents told their child is underweight, healthy, overweight and even very overweight!! 
What kind of damage is this doing! 
Stop putting so much pressure on children to fit into a category that isn't even realistic.
attributes.additional_details:
My son was recently regarded as overweight when his friend is acceptable. My son is 6 cm taller and only 7lb heavier! My friend worries her child is underweight but is deemed acceptable. Skin and bones is not a healthy target! 
I've personally suffered from an eating disorder and being told my child is overweight at 5 upset me. He's 114.6 cm and 23 kg!!
It's ridiculous and needs to be stopped!

attributes.action: Supermarket type trolleys to have a coin lock, or some other security system.
attributes.background: There need to be a law mandating trolley owners, supermarkets etc, to fit security features such as coin locks or similar, in order to keep abandoned trolleys out of our river systems and countryside.
attributes.additional_details: Much has been done to improve the water quality in our rivers and streams. Dumping into our waterways is commonplace and a disgrace. There is difficulty in  resolving these issues, but supermarket trolleys are one area that might be tackled.  A recent flood left a pile of 50+trolleys and tyres in a weirpool. Children were  climbing up and throwing trolleys into deep water of the weirpool.  2 kayakers were pushed by the current  into a submerged trolley, one being inverted. He nearly drowned.

attributes.action: Abolish the Scottish Parliament
attributes.background: The Scottish Parliament is a failed institution. It fails to govern properly. It was not set up to embroil us in referenda on Independence. All devolved services are failing due to lack of governance. I object to Nicola Sturgeon using my vote to remain in Europe as an excuse for Independence.
attributes.additional_details:
The money spent on the Scottish Parliament and the duplicated, devolved departments would be better spent on essential services.
It is simply an unnecessary tier of government.

attributes.action: Choice of Cannabis oil on NHS instead of chem/radio etc for all cancer patients
attributes.background: I would like the Government to allow cancer patients to choose cannabis oil as an alternative to radio or chemotherapy on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
Cannabis oil is derived from plants and herbs that were handed down for generations, whereas radio and chemotherapy can potentially destroy healthy cells as well as cancerous ones. 

Public opinion is growingly supportive of cannabis oil. The CBD in the oil prevents more growth and the THC in it destroys it. Cannabis oil costs less than chemo/radio and it does not destroy healthy cells. The NHS would save money, and people would not be held to ransom by pharmaceutical companies. A Ministry of Medicine could be created to research and regulate cannabis growth along with other remedies from plants.

attributes.action: Restore the Hereditary Peers and Appellate Committee to the House of Lords.
attributes.background: The House of Lords is no longer independent of the political parties in the House of Commons, leading to the destruction of the British Parliamentary system. We have lost Liberty and Justice because of this. To correct this we must restore the Hereditary Peers and Appellate Committee in the Lords.
attributes.additional_details: We are now leaving the EU, so we should set about restoring the institutions of the British state, which the EU has undermined with the support the political parties in the House of Commons. The House of Lords should be a House of legacy and law, a check on the power of political parties and the government. The political parties should no longer be able to stack the House to block the will of the British people.

attributes.action: Protect Freeholders from fraud by estate management companies.
attributes.background: Freeholders currently don't enjoy the same protection as leaseholders from unjustified estate charges. They are currently open to widespread and systematic fraud and some so called “estate management companies” are taking full advantage of this.
attributes.additional_details:
In all cases, regardless of whether it is freeholders or leaseholders who are being charged these fees…

It must be made a requirement that all fees pass the test of “reasonableness” and are backed by proper documentation.

Arbitrary unspecified “management fees” should be banned as I believe they already are in Scotland.

attributes.action: Allow GCSE Science Students Data Sheets with Ions, Equations & Reactivity Series
attributes.background: The outgoing GCSE Science Specifications include a 'Data Sheet' which consists of very important information for candidates, such as ions. It would be a disadvantage for Reformed GCSE students to not be given said information; especially considering that the new qualifications are more challenging.
attributes.additional_details: In GCSE Chemistry, a sheet with ionic formulae and the Reactivity Series of Some Common Metals is given. In GCSE Physics, a sheet consisting of all mathematical equations is also given. It would be a gross disadvantage for Reformed GCSE students to not be given said information; especially considering that the reformed qualifications are more challenging for individuals taking the examinations in Year 11 and without such sheets, comparison between Legacy and Incumbent qualifications is difficult.

attributes.action: Make it maditory for people over 60 to take a driving test every 5 years
attributes.background: Although evidence does suggest that most accidents are caused by 17-24 year old drivers, it is well known that the human body isnt as quick to respond as it was when you are younger. I propose it is about time we had a manditory test for those over the age of 60 every 5 years to reduce deaths.
attributes.additional_details: In 2011, there were 10,974 accidents involving elderly drivers over the age of 70.

attributes.action: Make GCSEs test students' abilities rather than their memories
attributes.background: The new GCSEs are now based on testing students' abilities to remember things more than to actually answer the question. This makes sense for subjects like history, business studies and biology where the facts are the most important thing. This is not the case for all subjects.
attributes.additional_details: For subjects such as english where students are no longer allowed the texts they are supposed to analyse in the exam at all, it doesn't test students ability to put forward an argument, it tests students' abilities to remember certain things. It is also not practical for physics as learning the 18 formulas in not beneficial and may cause marks to be dropped even though students know what to do but they cannot remember what equation to use.

attributes.action: Abolish the Lords Spiritual - let secular values prevail!
attributes.background:
The Lords Spiritual consists of 26 Bishops who sit in the House of Lords - including the infamous Justin Welby himself. All have a right to vote and they sit on the Government bench. They have too much religious influence over the United Kingdom. We should be secular!

Abolish the Lords Spiritual!

attributes.action: Give Self Employed Trainers  rights & access to  industrial tribunal services
attributes.background: Pass a bill to regulate awarding bodies of security level 2 qualifications disciplinary procedures when dealing with trainers. Stipulate Awarding bodies provide clear guidelines such as a documented strike 1,2,3 warnings, provide hearings & provide trainers/teachers an industrial  tribunal service.
attributes.additional_details: As a trainer of a security qualification an individual has to be  approved by a pick of 5 awarding bodies. Training is mandatory to work in the industry hence awarding bodies can pick and choose trainers. Awarding bodies  can place maladministration labels on an individuals resulting in a  life time ban without hearing. Most trainers earn the same as employed and can not afford the risk to go to an industrial tribunal leaving them exposed to anti-competitive practices, discrimination etc.

attributes.action: Modify the petition system to force Parliament debate of >100,000 signatures
attributes.background:
The present UK Government and Parliament petition system states that 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be considered for debate in Parliament."

This appears to be deliberately vague about who, and on what criteria, fair consideration will be given.

Remove "considered for"
attributes.additional_details:
The present UK Government and Parliament petition system states that 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be considered for debate in Parliament."

This appears to be deliberately vague about who, and on what criteria, fair consideration will be given.

Rewrite as 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be debated in Parliament."

attributes.action: Make All Public Parking including Hospitals 'FREE' for the Disabled
attributes.background:
It is a disgrace to make these pay, it it hit and miss with some charging and others not, should be the same throughout the country, I know some abuse the system with Blue Badges and should lose them for ever, the charges incurred it a lot of money for Disabled people.
We need a Three Hour system.
attributes.additional_details:
Hospitals make a lot of money already on poorly people, the Disabled should not be one, this is being Anti Disabled and must not be discriminated against.

Let's get things put in order with a system that the Disabled do not have to study each place on if they can or can not.

Disabled Agency sorts some things but money matters to these people on Low income.

attributes.action: Repeal the VED legislation Changes coming into force in April 2017
attributes.background: The proposed VED changes coming into force in April 2017 mean it is no longer an incentive to buy a low polluting car.
attributes.additional_details:
The new changes introduce the same basic charge on each subsequent year of ownership after the first year of ownership meaning if someone bought a 1 year old high polluting car they would pay the same tax as a 1 year old low polluting car removing the incentive to buy the economical car.

A much fairer system would be to move all of the band thresholds down so the emissions target for £0 VED is now 80g/km for example. And the 100g/km band now pays £30 a year and so on.

attributes.action: The National Curriculum to be run and controlled by an Education Council
attributes.background: Education has been used to sway voters for too long now. With each new Government comes a new National Curriculum. New 'ideas' or 'beliefs'. It's time for stability and for education to be in control of professionals and not politicians, by forming an Education Council of former Heads and teachers.
attributes.additional_details: Since 2010, the Education Department has been run by an accountant, a journalist, a solicitor and an economist. What qualifications do they have to decide on the best course of action for our children? The Government are too results driven. Schools should be places where children feel safe, where children go to enjoy learning, where children discover a passion for a given subject area. This is not happening under the current scrutiny from those who don't understand the education system.

attributes.action: Drivers of motor vehicles to use headlights at all times of the day and night.
attributes.background: Vehicles are often driven in poor light conditions. Vehicle colourings can make them nearly invisible against background colours. In daylight they can also be difficult to see. Compulsory headlights would make vehicles more visible and improve road safety. A no cost issue to motorists. A WIN WIN.

attributes.action: Impose minimum standards for UK phone network providers to meet.
attributes.background: Having tried several networks over the years I found that non of our providers can supply a minimum standard phone signal across Norfolk, yet we are now being told about 5G most of us bearly get signal for a call or text or 2G. Our phones are for our safety and with no signal we are not safe.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for Under 25's to £7.50 in line with all other workers.
attributes.background: Young people can be paid considerably less for work than an adult, in the same role at the same company; U18's can be paid as little as £4.05 per hour & U21 £5.60; This pay gap is discriminatory legislation, which says YP are worth less than older citizens (Regardless of ability to perform the job.)
attributes.additional_details:
It's near impossible to live a decent quality of life on earnings around the minimum wage; So why for under 25's who work in the same roles as adults can be paid £3.45p/h less an hour despite being potentially better educated more capable than their adult counterparts. Many under 25's work their jobs to help low-income parents provide necessities and I feel this discriminatory legislation therefore unfairly targets the young people of low-income backgrounds who are just about managing to cover the costs of running a household...

I therefore petition the government for pay equity for under 25's.

attributes.action: Ban strikes 1 week before and after the top 10 designated 'peak use' times p/a
attributes.background:
Striking should not be targeted at consumers. 

As strikes cite reasons such as 'safety' for their end purposes, there is no legitimate reason to arrange strikes around the busiest / highest consumer use times. 

This petition would stop consumer suffering whilst still protecting workers rights.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence in plentiful supply today, looking at post offices, airports, trains etc.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for office buildings to keep interior lighting on after hours.
attributes.background: Whilst out and about London recently on a Saturday night, I was struck by how many empty office buildings were lit up across the city with nobody at their desks. This is a massive waste of energy and resources and flies in the face of the Government commitment to reducing carbon emissions.

attributes.action: Solve the gridlock occuring on the M5 between Almondsbury & Clevedon.
attributes.background: Due to the design of the Avonmouth Bridge, the 3 mile long queues to leave the M5 at junction 19 (Portishead) both morning and evening, repeated accidents between junctions 18 and 19, in part due to road design, inpart due to careless driving, life on the M5 is now intolerable.
attributes.additional_details: One needs only reference Inrix, view CCTV or stand on a bridge to see the chaos and misery caused to locals, commuter, holiday makers and businesses. Now is the time to design a 2nd Avonmouth crossing, take local traffic for Portishead off at junction 18 (or use a design similar to J5-6, M20), bulldoze Gordano services, redesign junction 19, put in SMART motorway, widen the carriageways and if necessary re-route the motorway for long distance traffic from junction 15 to a new junction 19A.

attributes.action: Legalize the medicinal use and sale of Cannabis via prescription.
attributes.background:
Millions of people throughout the world and in the UK suffer from conditions of which Cannabis offers a significant and harmless relief. 
To name a few:
-Glaucoma
-Seizures (Dravet's syndrome)
-Alzheimer's Disease
-Multiple Sclerosis
-Arthritis
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.who.int/medicines/access/controlled-substances/6_2_cannabis_update.pdf

http://www.encod.org/info/700-MEDICINAL-USES-OF-CANNABIS.html

attributes.action: To build a new Northern bypass around Ipswich
attributes.background: The Orwell Bridge has been closed in Ipswich all morning due to high winds, causing traffic chaos and gridlock in the town, it's about time a Northern bypass around Ipswich was built to defer the traffic from the town when the bridge is closed.
attributes.additional_details: It's 2016 and it's ridiculous that such a large town is so reliant on the bridge being open, as soon as there's an accident or bad weather, it's closed and the traffic has nowhere to go but through the town, which the infrastructure just cannot cope, costing businesses millions of pounds in lost revenue, especially haulage companies as they're reliant on the a14 to and from the port of felixstowe, get this Northern bypass built.

attributes.action: Diwali is Hindu festival and for lot of Hindu it is also their New year as well.
attributes.background: If Diwali is made as a National Holiday like Christmas then it will save Hindu people to use their holiday

attributes.action: Put FEMINISM WEEK on the National Curriculum: female role models in all subjects
attributes.background: As a fully qualified teacher I know first hand that some schools rarely teach about feminism at all. For just one week of the academic year, if we could teach not just the history of feminism, but celebrate the achievements of females today in every subject, we could inspire true equality in the U.K
attributes.additional_details:
Feminism is already on the rise: our education system should be at the forefront of the movement. Not just #heforshe and #equalpay trending on Twitter; but opening the minds of all students male, female and LGTBQ to believe in total equality for their generation, both at home and in the work place - so no matter what gender you are born, you can dream just as big, and command the same respect.

I am aware that teachers have to cover what is on the exams but one week will not interfere too much.

attributes.action: Open Centres that provide Class A drugs like Heroin for free to prevent crime.
attributes.background: If there were Centers that provided class A drugs for free and a safe place to take them. Users Registered, agreed to treatment. Then Drug dealers would have no business, muggings, robberies and shoplifting would drop dramatically and few young people would start using.
attributes.additional_details: Open centres across the country. While keeping the sale and use of Heroin illegal elsewhere, in the Centres Heroin and other highly addictive class A drugs would be given to addicts that register and seek treatment. Over night drug dealers would be out of business, muggings, robbery’s, burglary’s and shop lifting would decrease dramatically as addicts no longer need to commit crime. Lastly, drug dealers wouldn’t be pushing drugs onto young naïve people in order to profit from their misery.

attributes.action: A 2nd EU Referendum to be held with Compulsory Voting for the Eligible.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to Conduct a 2nd Referendum with Compulsory voting  for all who are eligible, with an abstention option on the ballot paper. This will give a true majority of the UK voters wishes regarding the EU and a true mandate to Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The British Election Study asked a question on whether people regretted how they voted or not. Only 1% of people who voted Remain said they regretted their vote, but 6% of people who voted Leave said they regretted their vote.

attributes.action: Stop all ivory trade from the UK and press for bans globally
attributes.background: Ivory collected after 1947 is currently illegal globally, however, Britain still exports legal Ivory to many countries such as Hong Kong, this  contributes greatly to the Ivory trade and can help salesmen conceal their illegal imports from across Africa, drastically harming elephant populations.

attributes.action: Reinstate Postgraduate Loans To Other UK Citizens Living & Studying in England.
attributes.background: Appeal Against Student Finance England's decision to withdraw the funding of Scottish, Northern Irish and Welsh Postgraduate Students living and studying in England.
attributes.additional_details: The SFE waited until all the Scottish, Northern Irish and Welsh students living and studying in England had registered with their University before blocking their payments without any warning or notification. The SFE should be held accountable of how they have treated so many UK non-English nationals resulting in them with no funding and being forced off their studies. Is Student Finance England discriminating against UK citizens who are non-English Nationals from access to Higher Education?

attributes.action: Remove UK passports from disorderly passengers who cause disruption on flights
attributes.background: Media report drunk passengers cause problems & alcohol should be banned on flights. Alcohol is not the problem it is disorderly people. Most travellers enjoy a drink & cause no problems. Like football violence,  remove passports if they cause disruption rather than ban alcohol

attributes.action: (Electoral Postal Voting)! Only For The Elderly, Infirm & People on Holiday.
attributes.background: The Postal Voting System is outdated; many people who become Postal Voters are in many cases fit and have transport and are able to go to the Polling Station. There should be a Fine of £25 if you are able bodied and can easily get to a polling Station. Postal voting is open to large abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
If you are not able to physically get to a UK voting station you should have a voting card sent to your home or otherwise you'll have to convince Local Authorities why you cannot get to your Voting Station to vote.
If your reason is not convincing you will be  fined a minimum of £25.

attributes.action: Remove the tax rates that are now being put on student finance fee's.
attributes.background: Student finance is now to charge students a 4.6% (which may vary) tax rate on the loans they borrow for tuition and maintenance. Courses already cost £9k a year (most courses are 3 years) plus maintenance loans; this leaves the students with already a huge bill to pay before you introduce tax!
